business.headline: Sensex closes 250 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; Trent down 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.48 points to close at 83,627.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.95 points to end at 25,732.30.

India's basmati exporters worry as political turmoil grips IranFor many years, Iran was among India's most important markets for agricultural products, especially basmati rice. However, protests against the country's leadership and growing external pressure have unsettled trade flows.

Blinkit drops 10-minute delivery branding as Centre steps in after gig strikeThis move comes weeks after delivery workers across platforms staged strikes in late December, raising issues around working conditions, delivery pressure and lack of social security.

Budget 2026: What do startups expect from the next policy push?Budget 2026 is approaching and so are the expectations of the startup sector, which is looking for deeper reforms and long-term policy support.

Housing demand in India cools: What it means for homebuyersAccording to the latest PropIndex report by Magicbricks, housing demand in major cities fell by nearly 9% during the October–December 2025 quarter, while the supply of homes available for sale increased by over 3% in the same period.

Sensex ends 250 points lower: Why stock market fell today?The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.48 points to close at 83,627.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.95 points to end at 25,732.30. Losses were broad-based, reflecting cautious positioning amid global uncertainty and domestic technical resistance.

BCCL IPO closes soon: What does GMP tell about expected listing gain?Incorporated in 1972, Bharat Coking Coal Limited is engaged in the production of coking coal, non-coking coal, and washed coal. The company is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Coal India Limited.

Budget 2026: NBFCs call for liquidity support, faster recovery and tax reliefExpectations are rising in the NBFC sector ahead of Budget 2026. Industry leaders are calling for policy measures such as better liquidity access, faster recovery norms and tax relief to sustain lending momentum.

Eternal share price jumps 4% today: What's driving the rally?The stock jumped around 4% in early trade, and by midday was trading at approximately Rs 292.20, up 2.44%, as sentiment strengthened around the company's growth prospects.

Will Budget 2026 prioritise personal income tax cuts?As Budget 2026 approaches, expectations are rising around personal income tax relief. With consumption slowing and middle-class pressure growing, the key question is whether the government will ease tax burdens or stay fiscally cautious.

Vande Bharat Sleeper train is welcome, but let's have more Amrit Bharats Expresses, tooAs Vande Bharat trains redefine speed and comfort, the troubling question persists whether India's rail modernisation truly serves the majority who still travel daily in overcrowded general coaches without dignity.

How smaller cities are driving India's forex and overseas travel demandWhat was once a metro-led trend is now spreading deep into non-metro India. Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities are fuelling a sharp rise in overseas travel and foreign currency spending.

Amagi Media Labs IPO review: Should you subscribe? Check price band, GMPAmagi Media Labs IPO: The IPO includes a fresh issue of 2.26 crore shares, raising Rs 816.00 crore, along with an offer for sale of 2.69 crore shares worth Rs 972.62 crore.
Sensex opens over 250 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; Eternal up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 90.05 points to 83,788.12, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 37.50 points to 25,752.75 as of 10:12 am.

Gold rally is not stopping soon. But is buying at record levels a good idea?On Tuesday, gold prices eased slightly after hitting a new lifetime high a day earlier. Spot gold slipped 0.4% to $4,576.79 per ounce at around 07:04 AM.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO closes today: Should investors bid for BCCL on last day?Bharat Coking Coal IPO opened for subscription on January 9, 2026, and will close today, January 13, 2026. The allotment is expected to be finalised on January 14, 2026.

Alphabet crosses $4 trillion market cap as AI push boosts investor sentimentThe milestones mark a remarkable change in investor sentiment for Alphabet, with its stock surging about 65% in 2025, outperforming its peers on Wall Street's elite group of stocks, the so-called Magnificent Seven.
India's retail inflation hits 3-month high of 1.33% in DecemberIndia's retail inflation rose to 1.33% in December from 0.71% in November, as the decline in food prices slowed, government data showed.
Sensex jumps 302 points, Nifty above 25,750 as market snaps losing streakAt the close, the Sensex settled at 83,878.17, up 301.93 points, while the Nifty ended at 25,790.25, gaining 106.95 points.

Budget 2026: Is it time for capital gains clarity, and GST relief for real estate?As the countdown to Budget 2026 begins, real estate players are seeking clarity on capital gains taxation and GST relief to support long-term growth and investor confidence.

entertainment.headline: Amma challenged me: Mallika Prasad on her villainous act in Mardaani 3 The trailer for Mardaani 3 has generated significant attention, with audiences responding strongly to Mallika Prasad's portrayal of the antagonist Amma.

Disha Patani, Talwiinder hold hands in viral clip, internet asks are they dating A video from Nupur Sanon's wedding in Udaipur has gone viral, showing Disha Patani holding hands with Punjabi singer Talwiinder, leading to widespread speculation about their relationship status.

Best outdoor shoot of my life: Sharmila Tagore recalls Aranyer Din Ratri in Palamu Sharmila Tagore revisited the making of Satyajit Ray's Aranyer Din Ratri during its 4K screening in Delhi. She highlighted the film's lasting relevance and the tough conditions of the shoot that shaped its unique character.

Parasakthi director blasts Vijay fans: We're fighting against their rowdyism, goonism Parasakthi director Sudha Kongara Prasad criticised rowdy behaviour by Vijay fans allegedly targeting her film. The controversy highlighted challenges filmmakers face from aggressive fan bases amid film releases.

Bhartha Mahasayulaku Wignapthi review: Better than previous films, if that's the barRelease Date:Tue Jan 13, 2026 Bhartha Mahasayulaku Wignapthi movie review: Bhartha Mahasayulaku Wignapthi, a Sankranthi comedy starring Ravi Teja, Ashika Ranganath and Dimple Hayathi, was meant to signal a comeback. Instead, it settles for familiar gags and uneven laughs.

Jana Nayagan censor row: Top Tamil producer calls legal battle flabbergasting National Award-winning author and producer G Dhananjayan has weighed in on the legal dispute between the makers of Jana Nayagan and the Central Board of Film Certification, calling the situation unprecedented and urging for a resolution to benefit the film industry.

Who is Beatriz Taufenbach, actor with Yash in viral Toxic scene causing uproar? Actor Beatriz Taufenbach has become a central subject of conversation following her brief appearance alongside Yash in the teaser for Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups. The intimate scene featured in the teaser has drawn significant attention online.

Laikey Laikaa first poster: Rasha Thadani, Abhay Verma bring bloody romance The first poster of Laikey Laikaa, starring Rasha Thadani and Abhay Verma, teases a bold, street-style romantic-action story. The film is set for a 2026 release.

One Last Adventure: The Making of Stranger Things 5 debunks fan theories Netflix's documentary One Last Adventure explores the emotional and creative struggles behind Stranger Things 5 finale. It offers fans an intimate look at the series' closure without spoilers or secret episodes.

Actor Akshay Oberoi calls Toxic his most demanding action experience yet Actor Akshay Oberoi has revealed that preparing for Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups pushed him into a completely new physical and mental zone, unlike any action role he had done before.

Deepika-Ranveer's New York dinner date: Chef shares what they ordered Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh enjoyed a cosy dinner at a Michelin-starred restaurant in New York, delighting fans with their moments shared with chef Mayank Istwal. Their New Year trip also included visits to chef Vikas Khanna's restaurant and fan interactions.

Mark Ruffalo slams Trump as worst human being at Golden Globes. Watch Hollywood figures used the Golden Globes red carpet to highlight fatal ICE shootings and denounce US government policies, with Mark Ruffalo, Wanda Sykes and others voicing criticism and commemorating Renee Good.

RGV calls Dhurandhar 2 vs Toxic a 'judgement day' clash between truth and style Ram Gopal Varma called Dhurandhar 2 vs Toxic a clash of realism vs style, questioning whether audiences prefer consequence-driven cinema or grandeur. Read his long note inside.

After Alia Bhatt, Saba Pataudi praises Yami Gautam's performance in Haq: Work of art Yami Gautam's Netflix film Haq continues to win praise, with Saba Pataudi joining Alia Bhatt in applauding the actor's powerful performance. Calling the courtroom drama "relevant" and a "work of art," Saba hailed the film as a must-watch.

Zayn Malik teases his first world tour for 2026, will India make the cut? Pop star Zayn Malik has teased his inaugural world tour for 2026, sharing preliminary venues but omitting India and Asia from the initial list. This move follows his upcoming Las Vegas residency and recent musical collaborations.

Hema Malini shuts down rumours of rift with Sunny Deol: Very close to each other Hema Malini addressed the rumours of a rift between her and Dharmendra's sons, Sunny and Bobby Deol. In an interview, she talked about the interpersonal dynamics in the family and how Sunny is planning to take Dharmendra's legacy ahead.

Aamir Khan bursts into laughter as he watches Sunil Grover mimic him during shoot A behind-the-scenes moment from the promotional shoot of Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos captures Aamir Khan's enthusiastic reaction as Sunil Grover impersonates him, highlighting mutual respect and the lighthearted atmosphere on set.

Meet Marty Reisman, the man who inspired Timothy Chalamet's Marty Supreme Timothee Chalamet's character in Marty Supreme is inspired by table tennis legend named Marty Reisman, who was also a hustler who treated the game like prizefighting activity.

Priyanka Chopra's viral parenting tip is a winner. Nick Jonas agrees At the Golden Globe Awards 2026, Priyanka Chopra Jonas and Nick Jonas discussed their approach to balancing careers and parenting. Alongside Nick Jonas, her answer has found relatability among fans online.

general news.headline: Army chief reveals how 'certain' Op Sindoor orders got Pak to plead for peaceArmy Chief General Upendra Dwivedi revealed that a set of "certain orders" issued on May 10 last year proved to be a key turning point that pushed Pakistan, which suffered huge losses, to reach out for a ceasefire during Operation Sindoor.

Live: About 2,000, including security personnel, killed in protests so far, says Iranian officialIran Protest News Live Updates: Iran is facing one of its gravest crises since 1979 as nationwide protests intensify. An Iranian official said on Tuesday that around 2,000 people, including civilians and security personnel, have been killed, blaming "terrorists" for the deaths. The UN human rights chief said he was "horrified" by violence against peaceful protesters, while the Netherlands summoned Iran's ambassador over what it called excessive force and urged restoration of internet access. Iranian authorities report over 10,000 arrests amid an internet blackout, even as opposition figures urge US President Donald Trump to back protesters. Stay with indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

Shaksgam Valley: New India-China flashpoint and Pak's 'illegal' handoverThe sharp exchange between India and China over Kashmir's Shaksgam Valley has brought into renewed focus the strategically vital area that New Delhi maintains was illegally ceded by Pakistan to China in 1963.

US to invite India to join Pax Silica. Gamechanger alliance explained in 5 pointsUS Ambassador Sergio Gor said India would be invited to join Pax Silica, an alliance that seeks to set up an entire ecosystem for AI technology, starting from refining to manufacturing hi-tech components. Here we explain to you the meaning of Pax Silica, and its significance for India and other partners.

Khamenei militia raiding homes to seize Starlink gear, hide mass killings in IranAfter using Chinese or Russian military-grade jammers to disrupt Starlink, the Khamenei regime is now raiding homes to seize communication equipment to hide the mass killings in Iran. The government and its loyalists are communicating through a protected "whitelist" network as they brutally supress the protests.

Trump slaps 25% tariffs on Iran trade partners. Is India the real target?From Ukraine to Iran, every global crisis seems to come with consequences for India. On Tuesday, Trump's decision to impose a 25% tariff on Iran's trade partners has again placed India in US's line of fire.

Revenge of the Desert: How Mahmud Ghazni nearly fell after the Somnath plunderThis article is the first installment in our series, exploring how the powerful empire built by Mahmud Ghazni in Central Asia sowed the seeds of its own destruction.

Rahul Gandhi is now Tamil Nadu's 'Thalaiva' after 'Jan Nayak' flop in BiharAn AI-generated video released by the Tamil Nadu Congress shows Rahul Gandhi interacting with farmers, elderly women, and auto drivers, positioning him as a champion of the underprivileged and a mass leader.

What happens to 16 satellites PSLV lost in space? Ex-Isro engineer explainsTrouble struck near the end of the third stage, a solid-fuel motor that provides the final big push toward orbit. ISRO reported a sudden disturbance.

Heavy fine for every dog bite, every death, Supreme Court warns statesThe Supreme Court issued a stark warning to the central and state governments on Tuesday, saying that it will impose heavy compensation on authorities as they "failed miserably" to implement the ABC rules. The bench also pulled up dog feeders, saying they would be liable for attacks that have a lifelong impact on victims.

New Tata Punch launched at Rs 5.59 lakh, gets turbo-petrol engine and feature upgradesTata Motors has launched the updated 2026 Punch at Rs 5.59 lakh, introducing a turbo-petrol engine, refreshed styling and major feature upgrades to strengthen its position in the micro-SUV segment.

PM suppressing Tamils' voice: Rahul Gandhi alleges Centre blocking Jana NayaganA political controversy has erupted over the Centre's move to block the Tamil film Jana Nayagan, with Rahul Gandhi accusing the government of attacking Tamil culture. The issue highlights tensions between creative freedom and state regulation in Indian cinema.

Greenland not yet in US control, Bill Gates and others already planning to mine itEven as the tussle over Greenland heats up between Donald Trump and Denmark, tech bigwigs like Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, Sam Altman and others are already planning to use the icy island to mine for rare earth minerals and to set up a private town called Freedom City.

sports.headline: Joburg Super Kings captain Faf du Plessis ruled out of SA20 due to injury Faf du Plessis, captain of the Joburg Super Kings, has been ruled out of the rest of the SA20 season following a thumb injury sustained during the match against MI Cape Town on January 10.

Gujarat Giants look to extend winning streak against old foes Mumbai Indians Gujarat Giants look to continue their winning streak against Mumbai Indians in WPL 2026. The match promises a thrilling contest with Mumbai's perfect record against Gujarat at stake.

T20 World Cup: Bangladesh reiterates it won't play in India in latest meeting with ICC Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has reiterated that it won't play in India for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 in the latest meeting with the International Cricket Council (ICC). The ICC held a special meeting with the BCB to discuss the matter amid growing tensions between the BCB and the BCCI.

Watch: Sachin Tendulkar vs Amitabh Bachchan in hand-cricket battle, here's who won Sachin Tendulkar and Amitabh Bachchan shared a fun game of hand cricket during the ISPL event. The light-hearted exchange between the two legends quickly went viral and delighted fans online.

Shreyas Iyer is India's Mr Consistent: R Ashwin impressed with batter's ODI return R Ashwin hailed Shreyas Iyer as India's Mr Consistent in ODI cricket. Returning from injury in Vadodara, Iyer impressed immediately with a fluent 49, showing composure and timing in a pressure chase.

Sundar shouldn't have batted in 1st ODI, it was a wrong call: Former batter Mohammad Kaif has criticised Indian team management for allowing injured Washington Sundar to bat in the first ODI against New Zealand. The decision risked Sundar's fitness ahead of the crucial T20 World Cup 2026.

At 37, Ishant Sharma returns to captaincy, completes 200 List A wickets Vijay Hazare Trophy: Ishant Sharma returned to captain Delhi after seven years and reached 200 List A wickets. The 37-year-old pacer has been miserly in the ongoing domestic 50-over tournament.

Virat Kohli hasn't changed: R Ashwin's interesting take about regal ODI form India vs New Zealand: Former India spinner R Ashwin reflected on Virat Kohli's sensational ODI form, saying the former captain is in the right mental space and enjoying his cricket more than ever.

How Xabi Alonso's Real Madrid exit was more than an El Clasico loss Xabi Alonso's Real Madrid stint ended far earlier than expected despite early promise. From dressing room tensions to fading results, a slow build-up of issues finally cost the former Leverkusen coach his dream job.

Shreyas Iyer on verge of surpassing Virat Kohli, Shikhar Dhawan's major record Shreyas Iyer is on the verge of leaving behind Shikhar Dhawan and Virat Kohli to become the fastest Indian to 3,000 runs in ODIs. The star batter is just 34 runs away from achieving the milestone.

FC Barcelona announce Joao Cancelo return on loan deal from Al Hilal FC Barcelona have reinforced their backline by re-signing Joao Cancelo on loan from Al Hilal. The move comes a day after Barca lifted their first trophy of the season by beating Real Madrid.

Asif Nazrul: 'Impossible For Bangladesh To Play In India', Cites 'Anti-Bangladesh Campaign'Bangladesh's Youth and Sports Adviser, Asif Nazrul, has stated that India is unsafe for his country's cricketers, creating uncertainty around Bangladesh's participation in the upcoming T20 World Cup matches hosted in India. Nazrul claims 'it is impossible for Bangladesh to play in India' due to an ongoing 'anti-Bangladesh campaign' and a lack of security. He is demanding a neutral venue, such as Sri Lanka, for his team's matches. The adviser also questioned the neutrality of the International Cricket Council (ICC), suggesting it may be influenced by India. The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has indicated it is awaiting a final decision from the ICC on the matter, with a travel deadline for the team approaching on January 26.

Virat Kohli's brother takes cryptic dig on Sanjay Manjrekar for easy ODIs commentIND vs NZ: Virat Kohli's Vadodara masterclass reignited the ODI difficulty debate. His brother Vikas Kohli took a subtle dig at Sanjay Manjrekar after the former India batter's easy format remarks resurfaced online.

Kohli's young doppleganger recalls being called 'chhota cheeku' by India starVirat Kohli affectionately nicknamed his viral young fan 'chhota cheeku' ahead of the first ODI against New Zealand in Vadodara. The child went viral for having uncanny resemblance to Kohli's childhood photographs.

Gautam Gambhir biased? Did Ayush Badoni deserve India ODI call-upAyush Badoni earned his maiden call-up to Team India for the remaining ODIs against New Zealand. The selection has sparked criticism of head coach Gautam Gambhir, with accusations of favouritism from fans.

Wayne Rooney eyeing Manchester United return with Michael Carrick coaching linkWayne Rooney has opened the door to a Manchester United return as a coach. The club legend said joining Michael Carrick's interim setup would be a "no-brainer" if offered the opportunity.

Khel Ratna or not, Hardik Singh has eyes firmly on World Cup–Asian Games doubleWith the World Cup and Asian Games on his mind, Hardik Singh wants to achieve the double and stand on the top step of the podium at both events this year. In an exclusive chat with India Today, the Indian vice-captain talks about playing for HIL GC, 2026 goals and more.

Lakshya Sen vs Ayush Shetty to kick off blockbuster badminton week in DelhiIndia Open 2026: Former champions lead India's charge as Lakshya Sen faces Ayush Shetty in a blockbuster opener, while teenage debutant Tanvi Sharma steps into the spotlight in New Delhi.

After WPL snub, Australia captain Alyssa Healy announces shock retirement from cricketAustralia captain Alyssa Healy has announced her retirement ahead of the India series. The decision follows weeks of reflection and comes weeks after the veteran wicketkeeper-batter went unsold at the WPL auction.

Virat Kohli century or no food for a week: Kaif amazed by fan's faith in India starMohammed Kaif highlighted Virat Kohli's unmatched aura after a fan vowed to go hungry without a century. Kohli then fell just short of a hundred while guiding India's chase against New Zealand in Vadodara.

Kylian Mbappe pens special farewell message for Xabi Alonso after Real Madrid exitKylian Mbappe paid an emotional tribute to Xabi Alonso after Real Madrid confirmed the manager's sudden exit. Alonso's short Bernabeu stint ended following the Spanish Super Cup defeat to Barcelona.

Real Madrid part ways with Xabi Alonso after Spanish Super Cup final lossSpanish giants Real Madrid have decided to part ways with manager Xabi Alonso by mutual agreement. The club announced its decision just a day after Madrid's Spanish Super Cup loss against bitter rivals Barcelona.

WPL 2026: Warriorz meltdown in front Grace Harris blitz, RCB make it two in twoGrace Harris' blitz and disciplined bowling effort ensured that RCB made it two in two in the WPL 2026 as they crushed a hapless UP Warriorz side on Monday, January 12.

Bangladesh willing to play T20 World Cup in Pakistan: Bangladesh Sports advisorBangladesh sports advisor Asif Nazrul has stressed that it is impossible for their national cricket team to play T20 World Cup matches in India. Nazrul has stated that India he will not send the team to play matches in a country that has anti-Bangladesh sentiment.

Bangladesh backtracks hours after anti-India statement, await ICC responseT20 World Cup: Bangladesh backtracked hours after making a provocative anti-India statement on January 12. After the country's sports advisor claimed that the ICC had acknowledged the team's security concerns, the Bangladesh Cricket Board said in an official statement that it is still awaiting a formal response from the world body.

ICC rejects claim it validated Bangladesh's security concerns in India: SourcesThe ICC has rejected claims that it has validated Bangladesh's security concerns in India, sources told India Today on Monday, January 12.

Devdutt Padikkal scripts history as Karnataka beat Mumbai to reach semifinalDevdutt Padikkal created history by becoming the first batter to score 700 runs in multiple Vijay Hazare Trophy seasons as Karnataka knocked out Mumbai via the VJD method to reach the semifinals.

RCB vs UP Warriorz Highlights: Harris blitz helps Bengaluru thrash WarriorzRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) vs UP Warriorz (UPW) WPL Highlights: A brilliant innings from Grace Harris sees RCB in cruise control of this chase as UP Warriorz struggle to stem the run flow in Navi Mumbai.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
